class bad_function_call;
}}

{{tt|std::bad_function_call}} is the type of the exception thrown by {{l2tt std|cpp/utility/functional/function/operator()}} if the function wrapper has no target.

{{inheritance diagram/std-bad_function_call}}

===Member functions===
{{cpp/error/exception/member of derived|bad_function_call|std=c++11}}

{{cpp/error/exception/inherit}}

===Example===
{{example
|code=
#include &lt;functional&gt;
#include &lt;iostream&gt;

int main()
{
    std::function&lt;int()&gt; f = nullptr;
    try
    {
        f();
    }
    catch (const std::bad_function_call&amp; e)
    {
        std::cout &lt;&lt; e.what() &lt;&lt; '\n';
    }
}
|p=true
|output=
bad function call
}}
